channel.title: Pickup limited to 1
channel.description: I'm sorry if this is really basic and you'll find it pointless to help me (I'm kinda new to coding lol) when I do ::pickup (item) (amount) it only lets me get 1 at a time (unless it's a noted item or a stackable item) even when I make a command that spawns items (such as ::foodzor addItem(391 (un noted manta) 15); it only gets one, if you can help thanks :)

item.title: Pickup limited to 1
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“CoreVersion, post:6, topic:419676”]Thats because you can’t spawn lots of items that aren’t stackable.

The pickup command is supposed to be that way, it’s normal.
As for the food command, since you’re new, and probably don’t understand the guy above ^,
just copy the ‘addItem’ like so;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("food") { addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); sendMessage or sM("HAVE SOME FUCKING LOVELY FOOD YOU FAT FUCK!"); }

That would give 5 mantas :/[/quote]

for(int i = 0; i < amount; i++) { addItem(itemId, 1); }

Or the generic fix that will work for anything… Although I don’t recommend it for anything other than unstackable items. Its up to the OP to fix that himself

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup limited to 1
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Bryan Owner_Bryan
item.description:
@Owner_Bryan wrote:

[quote=“CoreVersion, post:6, topic:419676”]Thats because you can’t spawn lots of items that aren’t stackable.

The pickup command is supposed to be that way, it’s normal.
As for the food command, since you’re new, and probably don’t understand the guy above ^,
just copy the ‘addItem’ like so;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("food") { addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); sendMessage or sM("HAVE SOME FUCKING LOVELY FOOD YOU FAT FUCK!"); }

That would give 5 mantas :/[/quote]

Yeah thats a good point then they can just do that command over and over till they get a full pack didnt even think of that LOL

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup limited to 1
item.dc:creator: @CoreVersion CoreVersion
item.description:
@CoreVersion wrote:

Thats because you can’t spawn lots of items that aren’t stackable.

The pickup command is supposed to be that way, it’s normal.
As for the food command, since you’re new, and probably don’t understand the guy above ^,
just copy the ‘addItem’ like so;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("food") { addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); addItem(391, 1); sendMessage or sM("HAVE SOME FUCKING LOVELY FOOD YOU FAT FUCK!"); }

That would give 5 mantas

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup limited to 1
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

You’ll have to add a check to see if the item is unnoted, and if it is, loop for the amount and add one to the inventory each time

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup limited to 1
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Bryan Owner_Bryan
item.description:
@Owner_Bryan wrote:

He ment post a picture of your spawn system from your source files, it would be really helpful to somone that would like to help you.

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup limited to 1
item.dc:creator: @Pwnerofppl Pwnerofppl
item.description:
@Pwnerofppl wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:419676”][quote author=Pwnerofppl link=topic=522222.msg3796933#msg3796933 date=1319689470]
I’m sorry if this is really basic and you’ll find it pointless to help me (I’m kinda new to coding lol) when I do ::pickup (item) (amount)
it only lets me get 1 at a time (unless it’s a noted item or a stackable item) even when I make a command that spawns items (such as ::foodzor addItem(391 (un noted manta) 15); it only gets one, if you can help thanks
[/quote]

Might help if you posted the code for your pickup command[/quote]
When I do ::pickup 00391 15
It only gives me one. Even if I made the foodzor command it would give me 1.

Read full topic
